items.title: Google has a fix for all of the broken Chromecasts
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Google started rolling out an update on Thursday to fix Chromecasts that lost the ability to cast.
- The new update addresses issues with Chromecast devices that were bricked after a factory reset.
- Affected owners received confirmation from Google that everything should function normally now.
- The update includes a new Google Home app version (3.30.1.6 for Android, 3.30.106 for iOS) to revive broken Chromecast devices.
- The exact cause of the issues was not disclosed, but it may be linked to an expired certificate according to user findings.
- The rollout of the new app update began recently and may take a few days to reach all users.

items.title: Mark Rober’s Tesla Video: Controversy and Analysis
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Mark Rober's video compares Tesla’s Autopilot with lidar-equipped vehicles by testing their braking before hitting a wall.
- The Tesla Model Y crashed into the wall while the lidar vehicle stopped successfully.
- The video garnered 10 million views in two days, praised for exposing Autopilot's shortcomings but also criticized for possible deception.
- Several claims from viewers suggest inconsistencies in the video, questioning whether Autopilot was active during the test.
- Rober released raw footage showing Autopilot was engaged moments before the crash, but critics argue it disengaged right before impact.
- Concerns have been raised regarding Rober's potential sponsorship by lidar company Luminar due to its prominent branding in the video.
- Rober denied any compensation from Luminar, claiming it was not a paid promotion.

items.title: Perplexity dunks on Google’s ‘glue on pizza’ AI fail in new ad
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Perplexity launches a new ad featuring Squid Game star Lee Jung-jae.
- The ad humorously references a Google AI error suggesting using glue to make cheese stick to pizza.
- Google’s AI Overviews have faced criticism for inaccuracies, including the controversial glue advice.
- Perplexity positions itself as a viable alternative to Google’s AI offerings, facing its own allegations of content plagiarism.

items.title: A sodium-ion portable power bank comes to market
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Elecom introduces the first consumer-ready sodium-ion power bank, the Na Plus, with a capacity of 9,000mAh.
- The Na Plus is claimed to last up to 5,000 charges and can operate in extreme temperatures from -30 to 122°F.
- Priced at 9,980 yen (around $67), it is debuting in Japan with no current plans for wider rollout.
- The power bank features 45W output through USB-C and 18W through USB-A, taking about two hours to fully charge.
- Sodium-ion technology is seen as more environmentally friendly and safer than lithium-ion, though it is bulkier and heavier due to lower energy density.

items.title: Great savings on the EcoFlow Delta Pro 3, which will keep your home powered
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- EcoFlow is offering discounts on its portable batteries and power stations through March 26th.
- The Delta Pro 3 power station is currently priced at $2,899, a $700 reduction from its usual price of $3,699.
- The Delta Pro 3 can power 120V and 240V appliances, charge via solar or AC, and multiple units can be linked for more power.
- EcoFlow's River 3 Portable Power Station is also on sale for $189, ideal for camping and outdoor use.

items.title: The entire story of Twitter / X under Elon Musk
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- X will start charging new users in two countries $1 per year.
- Users reporting smaller than expected ad revenue sharing payments.
- Elon Musk seeks a second chance with X after his previous failures.
- The extravagant ‘X’ sign atop the former Twitter HQ has been dismantled.
- ‘For Elon Musk, X equals everything’ as his vision expands.
- Instagram challenges Twitter with its new Threads app.
- X's ad revenue sharing model under scrutiny amid performance concerns.
- A significant cyberattack claimed by Musk during an outage affecting hundreds of thousands of users.
- A Twitter logo from the prior HQ is up for auction amidst the rebranding effort.

items.title: US Tariffs: How Trump’s Tax is Impacting Big Tech and Beyond
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
* President Trump has imposed tariffs on goods imported from Mexico, Canada, and China.
* Big Tech companies have mostly remained silent on the potential impact of these tariffs on their operations.
* Automakers are expected to face significant consequences from Trump’s tariffs, which include a 25% tax on imports from Mexico and Canada, effective immediately.
* Companies like Lego, BMW, and Foxconn have commented on how tariffs will affect pricing and supply chains.
* Target and Best Buy CEOs indicated that prices for consumers may rise due to the tariffs primarily affecting products from Mexico.

items.title: Big Tech is now slightly less silent on Trump’s tariffs
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- President Trump’s tariffs on imports from Mexico, Canada, and China are now in effect, largely unopposed by Big Tech.
- Companies like Walmart express commitment to keeping prices low while CEOs from Best Buy and Target predict imminent price increases.
- Gigabyte and Framework discuss potential price adjustments, while many other major companies remain silent or decline to comment.
- The Trump administration may alter tariffs, with a recent temporary exemption announced for automotive tariffs on Canada and Mexico.
- Long-term effects of tariffs on tech product pricing remain uncertain until major launches occur.

items.title: Pixel 9A leaks in review videos before it’s even announced
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Leaked videos of the Pixel 9A have surfaced before its official announcement.
- YouTubers Sahil Karoul and The Mobile Central showcase the phone's design and performance.
- The Pixel 9A features a flat back design, a 6.3-inch display, and a 5,100mAh battery.
- Camera specs include a 48-megapixel main sensor, 13-megapixel ultrawide, and 13-megapixel selfie camera; video quality is subpar at night.
- Expected reveal date is March 19th, with various color options including purple, pink, black, and white.

items.title: Snap’s AR Spectacles now support a virtual keyboard and GPS
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Snap's Spectacles now feature GPS for navigation and improved hand tracking.
- An AR keyboard allows for text entry without a connected smartphone.
- New AR capabilities include location-based gaming and walking course development for users.
- Spectacles remain developer-only, requiring a $99 monthly rental commitment for at least a year.

items.title: Trump claims Biden pardons are ‘void’ due to autopen usage
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Trump asserts that some of Biden's pardons are void because they were allegedly signed using an autopen.
- He claims that Biden was unaware of the pardons, citing a post on Truth Social.
- Critics point out that Trump's claims lack evidence, and Biden has publicly addressed the pardons.
- Autopen usage by presidents has historical precedent, with past presidents like Ford and Obama using them for signing documents.
- The Justice Department has previously indicated there is no legally prescribed method for executive clemency signature.

items.title: Max just wiped its classic Looney Tunes lineup
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery removed the entire lineup of classic Looney Tunes shorts (1930-1969) from its streaming service, Max.
- The company confirmed the focus will shift to adult and family programming rather than kids' content.
- This follows earlier removals of Looney Tunes episodes at the end of 2022 and confusion over the series' availability.
- Newer Looney Tunes content remains available on Max.
- This content purge is part of broader cuts following David Zaslav's takeover of Warner Bros. Discovery.
- Max had also ended its streaming deal for Sesame Street and made notable content changes under the new administration.

items.title: Google’s Gemini AI is really good at watermark removal
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Google is expanding its experimental Gemini 2.0 Flash AI model to more developers globally.
- The AI can generate images from text prompts and edit them, including removing watermarks with precision.
- Tools like Watermark Remover.io can scrub marks from Shutterstock while Gemini 2.0 Flash is reportedly better at handling complex watermarks.
- After watermark removal, it can add an “edited with AI” mark but that's also removable by AI tools.
- It can add recognizable images of real people, unlike the full Gemini model.
- Currently, these features are only available to developers via AI Studio with no confirmed safeguards against misuse.

items.title: This hospital-grade snot sucker makes it easier to clear your baby’s nose
Xbox 360 consoles can now be hacked with just a USB key
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Xbox 360 modders have a new software exploit called [BadUpdate](https://github.com/grimdoomer/Xbox360BadUpdate) that allows running unsigned code via a USB key.
- The method enables access to the homebrew store, which includes games, apps, emulators, and utilities without opening the console.
- Limitations include needing to manually patch executables and the exploit’s reliability can vary, requiring reactivation on each console boot.

items.title: How Trump's tariff chaos is already changing global trade
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Evan Smith, cofounder and CEO of Altana, discusses how tariffs and supply chains are evolving.
- Altana predicts the breakdown of globalization due to geopolitical tensions and climate issues.
- The conversation highlights the impact of tariffs on supply chains and global trade dynamics.

items.title: All the smart home news, reviews, and gadgets you need to know about
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The smart home technology includes devices that enhance convenience and safety, like smart lights, locks, and vacuums.
- New devices and features are constantly emerging, making it challenging to stay updated.
- The article promises to provide continuous updates on smart home technology from major brands like Apple, Amazon, Samsung, and Google.
- A focus is on the integration of new standards like Matter and Thread for improved device interoperability.

items.title: Roblox’s new AI model can generate 3D objects
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Roblox launches and open-sources Cube 3D, its foundational AI model for generating 3D objects.
- Cube aims to enhance 3D creation efficiency, allowing developers to explore creative options quickly.
- The model tokenizes 3D objects to predict shapes and build complete models.
- It is trained on a mix of licensed, publicly available datasets, and internal Roblox experience data.
- Future plans include generating objects from images and integrating various input types like text and video.

items.title: Zoom’s AI will soon help you do busywork, too
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Zoom’s AI Companion is getting an “agentic” upgrade, launching at the end of this month.
- This upgrade will allow the AI to identify and perform tasks such as scheduling meetings and generating documents.
- A new Tasks tab in the Zoom Workplace will provide access to these features at no additional cost to users.
- Additional updates include a voice recorder for mobile that transcribes and summarizes meetings, and a live notes feature generating real-time summaries, launching in May.
- Zoom will also introduce a $12/month Custom AI Companion add-on next month, including an AI avatar feature.

items.title: Discord Integrates Social Features Directly Into Games
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Discord launches a new Social SDK for game developers to integrate social features directly into games.
- The SDK offers functionalities like friends lists, cross-platform messaging, voice communication, and more, available even for users without a Discord account.
- Account linking is available for a more integrated experience.
- Compatible with C++, Unreal Engine, Unity, and supports Windows 11+ and macOS, with console and mobile support coming soon.
- Developers like Theorycraft Games and Tencent Games are already implementing the SDK.

items.title: The OneXSugar asks: what if Nintendo Switch could transform into Nintendo DS?
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The OneXSugar is a transforming device with swing-out gamepads and screens, inspired by the Nintendo Switch and Nintendo DS.
- It will be available for preorder in May and features Qualcomm's Snapdragon G3 Gen 3 processor.
- Designed by OneXPlayer, it aims to cater to the popular Android gaming market, particularly in China.

items.title: Google is switching legacy G Suite users to pooled Workspace storage
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google is transitioning G Suite legacy free edition users to pooled storage starting May 1st.
- Previously, individual users had 15GB of free storage, ideal for families sharing a domain.
- The move aims to simplify storage management, allowing shared access across all users in an organization.
- No action is needed from users, and opting out is not available.
- Users can purchase additional storage at discounted rates, starting at increments of 100GB for $15.
- Storage limits can still be set for individual users by account admins after the transition.
- This change was anticipated, as Google had previously announced plans for pooled storage in January 2022 but allowed free legacy accounts to continue.

items.title: Bambu Lab launches 3D-printable toys with reusable, programmable electronics
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Bambu Lab has launched CyberBrick, a toy system that combines reusable and programmable electronics with 3D-printable models.
- The initial Kickstarter campaign has surpassed its funding goal; kits are expected to reach backers by May 2025.
- Official toys include a forklift, truck, and soccer bot, starting at $29.99, with options for pre-printed kits.
- Community designs for CyberBrick include a lunar rover, walking table, and replica Tesla Cybertruck, showcasing the system's flexibility.
- Bambu aims to create a cohesive ecosystem, expanding beyond toys to include components for timelapse 3D printing. 
- CyberBrick designs are compatible with various 3D printers, not limited to Bambu's products, addressing past user concerns regarding printing restrictions.

items.title: Microsoft accidentally wipes out Copilot in latest Windows 11 update
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft’s Copilot app is unintentionally uninstalled on some Windows 11 devices due to the latest March update.
- The issue started with the Patch Tuesday updates on March 11th, 2025.
- Microsoft acknowledges the issue and advises affected users to reinstall Copilot from the [Microsoft Store](https://apps.microsoft.com/detail/9nht9rb2f4hd).
- Microsoft is rolling out a new version of Copilot with improved UI and new features like a press-to-talk hotkey.
- A special event is planned for April 4th, 2025, where new Copilot features will be announced by Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman.

items.title: Alphabet spins off Starlink competitor Taara
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Taara, a light-based internet project, is spinning off from Alphabet’s X incubator into an independent company.
- The technology utilizes lasers for data transmission, aiming to rival Starlink in connecting rural areas.
- Alphabet retains a minority stake in Taara, which has raised funds from Series X Capital and operates in 12 countries.
- Taara’s technology enables data transmission of up to 20 gigabits per second over distances of 20km using tower-mounted terminals, cheaper than fiber installation.
- The company plans to launch a compact version of its technology in a chip by 2026.
- Taara claims to offer significantly more bandwidth than Starlink for a lower cost.

items.title: Dude Perfect and Mark Rober may be the next YouTubers to get big streaming deals
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Netflix and other streaming platforms are seeking to sign YouTubers for potential streaming deals.
- Dude Perfect and Mark Rober have been approached by Netflix due to their popularity.
- Netflix's reluctance to allow sales promotions in shows has complicated negotiations with Rober, who sells robotics kit subscriptions.
- The success of MrBeast’s 'Beast Games' has prompted increases in creator-signing ambitions from streaming platforms.
- Amazon reportedly made over $100 million from MrBeast's show and is negotiating for additional seasons.

items.title: SwitchBot’s next smart hub comes with a control knob
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- SwitchBot is preparing the new Matter-enabled smart hub, SwitchBot Hub 3, as per a CSA registration.
- The Hub 3 features a display and a physical control knob for functions like adjusting temperature and media volume.
- It supports major platforms, voice control via Alexa and Google Assistant, and has four customizable quick-scene buttons.

items.title: Roblox: all the news about the popular social and gaming platform
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Roblox has introduced an AI chatbot to assist users in building virtual worlds.
- New generative AI tools aim for easier design, mimicking Westworld's user experience.
- A child safety group called ROOST has been formed by Roblox, Google, Discord, and OpenAI to enhance online safety.
- Following investigations, several unlicensed Robux casinos have shut down.
- Roblox has launched a Top 100 music chart for popular in-game music.
- To bypass app store fees, Robux purchases are incentivized through gift cards and direct purchases on web and computer.
- New restrictions will limit messaging for users under 13, requiring parental approval for in-game chats.
- Kids under 13 are prohibited from accessing 'social hangout' spaces and certain interactive features starting November 18.

items.title: The head of a Biden program that could help rural broadband has left
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Evan Feinman has left his position as director of the $42.5 billion Broadband Equity, Access, and Deployment (BEAD) program.
- Feinman warned of "deeply negative outcomes" due to potential shifts towards satellite internet services like Elon Musk's Starlink.
- Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick announced a review of the program, which has yet to connect anyone to the internet.
- The BEAD program is part of Biden's $1 trillion infrastructure spending bill, aiming to enhance internet access in underserved areas.
- Concerns raised regarding a political shift towards favoring satellite technology over fiber-based internet.
- Actions by the current administration may delay broadband rollout in multiple states, impacting rural access significantly.

items.title: The iPhone 17 Air makes other models look chunky in new leaked dummy shots
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- New leaked dummy models of the iPhone 17 show a significant design difference compared to other models.
- Expected to feature a 6.6-inch screen, it will be slimmer than the current iPhone 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max.
- iPhone 17 Air rumors include a thickness of 5.5mm, high-end features like a 120Hz ProMotion display, and an estimated price of around $900.

items.title: How to set up Routines on your Samsung Galaxy phone
items.author: David Nield
items.summary:
- Samsung Galaxy phones offer a Routines tool to automate repetitive tasks.
- Routines consist of triggers (like time, location, phone states) and actions (such as adjusting settings or launching apps).
- Users can customize Routines with multiple triggers and actions for versatile automation.
- Pre-made Routines are available in the 'Discover' tab under 'Modes and Routines' in Settings.
- To create a Routine, navigate to 'Settings', then 'Modes and Routines', and tap the '+' button.
- Users can set conditions for triggers and specify actions, including adding multiple actions and defining their sequence.
- Routines can run immediately if their conditions are already met when saved.
- Users can manage Routines by viewing, editing, or deleting them under the 'Routines' tab, and view history of recently run Routines.

items.title: This gaming mouse has a striking skeletonized design and hot-swap batteries
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- The AM Infinity Mouse by Angry Miao features a skeletonized magnesium-alloy shell weighing only 49 grams.
- It offers hot-swappable batteries, claiming "infinite" battery life with a spare available via the 2.4GHz receiver.
- Conventional features include an 8,000Hz polling rate, PixArt PAW3950 optical sensor with 30,000 DPI, and TTC Orange Dot Optical V2 micro switches.
- Supports 2.4GHz, Bluetooth, and wired USB-C connections, with battery life lasting up to 17 hours on 2.4GHz and 43 hours on reduced 1,000Hz polling rate.
- Aesthetic design may lead to concerns about dust buildup; inspired by automotive designs like the Lotus Evanora.
- The mouse is priced relatively affordably at $125 for Kickstarter preorders ending March 17th, with final units expected to ship in June.

items.title: A bad movie full of big ideas about tech
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The Electric State is a poorly received new movie that may still achieve cultural relevance in discussions about tech movies.
- Mickey 17 is a new film from the director of Parasite, blending action and thematic exploration of humanity.
- Everybody’s Live with John Mulaney is a new Netflix show that returns to a quirky style liked by fans.
- Skich is a new alternative iOS app store in the EU promising lower fees and better discovery for users.
- A new podcast series from Vox called Good Robot explores the implications of AI.

items.title: Joby will launch UK air taxi service with Virgin Atlantic
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Virgin Atlantic partners with Joby Aviation to launch an air taxi service in the UK.
- Joby’s aircraft can reach speeds of 200mph, travel 150 miles on a single charge, and is significantly quieter than conventional aircraft.
- The service will allow bookings through Virgin Atlantic's website and app, pending FAA certification.
- Proposed flight durations include 15 minutes from Manchester Airport to Leeds and 8 minutes from Heathrow to Canary Wharf.
- Joby aims to provide competitive pricing compared to existing ground ridesharing options.
- Other companies in the air taxi market include Archer Aviation and Volocopter, but facing challenges like safety regulations and airport infrastructure.

items.title: Air taxis: the latest on the flying electric cars bringing the Jetsons dream to life
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Virgin Atlantic partners with Joby Aviation to launch an air taxi service in the UK.
- Joby’s aircraft can reach speeds of 200 mph, travel 150 miles on a single charge, and is much quieter than conventional aircraft.
- Archer Aviation raises $300 million to enhance manufacturing for an air taxi network set to launch in Los Angeles for the 2026 Olympics.
- Archer also collaborates with Anduril Industries to develop military aircraft, starting with a hybrid VTOL model.
- Electric aviation startup Beta Technologies announces the first flight of its production ALIA aircraft and seeks FAA certification.
- New FAA regulations for eVTOL aircraft set to guide air taxis, cargo delivery, and more, marking a major step in aviation technology.

items.title: A DOGE staffer broke Treasury policy by emailing unencrypted personal data
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- A staffer at DOGE, Marko Elez, violated Treasury policy by sending unencrypted personal data to Trump administration officials.
- Elez, previously employed at SpaceX and X, resigned over racist social media posts but was rehired by DOGE.
- 19 state attorneys general are suing the Treasury over DOGE's system access; a court has limited its capabilities due to concerns about Elez's actions.

items.title: Sonos is still trying to figure out why everyone hates its app
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Sonos is focusing on understanding and addressing issues with its app as stated by chief innovation officer Nick Millington.
- The efforts come in response to negative user feedback following a controversial redesign in May 2024.
- Improvements being worked on include alarm snoozing, better queue management, and playlist editing.
- Users can again snooze alarms and check the battery status of portable Sonos speakers.
- Playlist editing and queuing entire folders from local music libraries are planned for upcoming releases.

items.title: The Sonos app fiasco: how a great audio brand nearly ruined its reputation
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Sonos' chief marketing officer, Jordan Saxemard, has departed immediately amid internal restructuring.
- Lindsay Whitworth will take over marketing leadership on an interim basis, supported by interim CEO Tom Conrad.
- The company is facing backlash following its controversial app redesign last year, which triggered layoffs and management shake-ups, including the resignation of CEO Patrick Spence.
- Sonos is reportedly attempting to regain customer trust and improve employee morale after a challenging period marked by product release failures and operational missteps.

items.title: District 9 director Neill Blomkamp is planning a new Starship Troopers movie
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Neill Blomkamp is set to write and direct a new Starship Troopers movie for Columbia Pictures.
- The film will be based on Robert A. Heinlein’s 1959 novel and not a sequel or remake of the 1997 film.
- This marks the first live-action entry in the franchise since 2008.
- Blomkamp's wife, Terri Tatchell, will co-produce the film.
- The release date for the movie has not been announced.

items.title: The Vision Pro Metallica concert video is the best Apple Immersive video yet
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple released a new concert video featuring Metallica, showcasing three songs: "Whiplash," "One," and "Enter Sandman."
- The video includes emotional moments, such as lead singer James Hetfield interacting with a fan.
- The 25-minute video uses Apple's 180-degree format and high production values, enhancing the viewing experience and emotional impact.
- The immersive quality of the video sets a new standard for Apple's future content in the Immersive collection.

items.title: Everything we know about Apple’s Vision Pro
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Apple Vision Pro will launch in February and is priced at $3,499.
- The headset features visionOS, custom-built for the device, enhancing AR experiences.
- A Metallica concert video is released as the first immersive content for the Vision Pro.
- Developers are getting access to a beta version of visionOS 2.4, which introduces new guest features and apps.
- Apple is also developing features for better integration with Mac devices, enhancing usability as a general-purpose computing device.
- Support for PSVR 2 controllers is rumored, aiming to expand the gaming capabilities of the Vision Pro.

items.title: Steam’s Spring Sale is taking up to 75 percent off some of our favorite games
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary: - Steam Spring Sale runs until 1PM ET on March 20, 2025. - Discounts include up to 75% off various titles, including classics and new releases. - Chrono Trigger available for $3.74, Cyberpunk 2077 down to $42.76 including the Phantom Liberty expansion. - Doom(2016) is priced at $1.99. - Other discounted titles include Inscryption for $7.99 and Vampire Survivors for $3.74. - Additional deals on Sonos Ray and Headspace subscription available.

items.title: Severance isn’t in a rush
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The latter part of *Severance*’s second season has a slower pace, focusing on character development and flashbacks.
- Episodes explore backstories and worldbuilding, revealing the depths of Lumon's unethical practices.
- Key upcoming events may lead to crucial plot conclusions in the finale, including Mark's attempts to rescue Gemma and revelations about Lumon's secrets.

items.title: The Best Bluetooth Trackers for Finding Your Stuff
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Bluetooth trackers help locate lost items by connecting to a phone app.
- Features include precision tracking, notifications for leaving items behind, and QR codes for item return.
- Major options include Apple AirTags and Tile trackers, each with pros and cons depending on user needs (compatibility, battery replacement).
- Apple AirTags utilize Ultra Wideband (UWB) technology for precise tracking, while Tiles have a wider range of shapes and sizes, suitable for various items.
- Recent improvements include enhanced anti-stalking measures for both brands.

items.title: This bullet hell shooter mixes retro and modern in all the right ways
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- **Game:** *Star of Providence* combines retro and modern gameplay styles in a roguelike bullet hell shooter format.
- **Gameplay:** Players explore randomly generated dungeons, collect powerful weapons, and fight diverse enemies.
- **Mechanics:** Tight controls allow for fluid movements; players can dash to escape danger and use bombs to clear projectiles.
- **Strategic Choices:** Players must make decisions regarding weapon upgrades and shop purchases that impact their success.
- **Boss Fights:** Encounter large, unpredictable bosses that require strategy and skill to defeat.
- **Pacing:** Games are fast-paced, enabling quick dungeon runs and minimal downtime between attempts.
- **Availability:** *Star of Providence* is currently available on Nintendo Switch and PC.

items.title: Teeing off at the wildly high-tech future of golf
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- TGL is a new golf league co-founded by Tiger Woods, aiming to reinvent the game for a modern audience.
- Matches take place at a unique venue, SoFi Center, featuring high-tech simulators and a 53-foot screen.
- The league incorporates elements from other sports and entertainment, like team formats and engaging audience experiences.
- Gameplay is quickened with a 40-second shot clock and a simplified scoring system, holding matches on Mondays and Tuesdays.
- Innovative broadcasting techniques include a wide array of cameras providing unique angles, including drone footage.
- The league's technological backbone involves advanced simulators, like Toptracer and Full Swing, to track shots and improve viewer experience.

items.title: The Best Indie Games We're Playing Right Now
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The article highlights various indie games recommended by Verge staff, including:
  - **Star of Providence**: A roguelike bullet hell shooter with retro and modern elements, exploring randomly generated dungeons.
  - **MainFrames**: A charming platformer set inside computers featuring an adorable floppy disk character.
  - **Sayonara Wild Hearts**: A rhythm game that combines various gameplay elements and narratives, recently launched on PS5 with new features.
  - **Die in the Dungeon**: A roguelike deck-builder with dice mechanics reminiscent of *Slay the Spire*.
  - **While Waiting**: A game reflecting on the joys of boredom with quirky minigames.
  - **Spirit Swap**: A narrative-driven match-3 game with a lo-fi soundtrack, offering more than just casual gameplay.
  - Participating in [Steam Next Fest](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fstore.steampowered.com%2Fsale%2Fnextfest) to discover new indie games.

items.title: Major Issues for Samsung HW-Q990D Soundbar Owners After Firmware Update
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Samsung's HW-Q990D soundbar rendered unresponsive due to a faulty firmware update (version 1020.7).
- Customers report soundbar freezes on eARC input; factory resets and SmartThings access are ineffective.
- Issues reported globally, with customers from the US, Austria, Philippines, and Malaysia affected.
- Widespread complaints on [Samsung's community forums](https://us.community.samsung.com/t5/Home-Theater/Samsung-Q990D-unresponsive-after-1020-firmware-update/td-p/3168571), [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/Soundbars/comments/1jarng6/q990d_samsung_soundbar_bricked_only_shows_tv_earc/), and [AVSForum](https://www.avsforum.com/threads/samsung-hw-q990d-11-1-4-dolby-atmos-soundbar-review-one-of-the-best-just-got-better.3298094/page-33#replies-header).
- Other Samsung models like HW-Q800D and HW-S801D may also be impacted, though Q990D is primarily affected.
- Customers advised to disable automatic updates until further notice; Samsung has been contacted for comment, with some users told to send devices for repair.

items.title: Here are the best AirPods deals you can get right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Discounts on Apple's AirPods lineup are available, including AirPods Max, AirPods 4, and AirPods Pro.
- The new AirPods 4 are priced at $129 for the standard model and $179 for the model with Active Noise Cancellation (ANC).
- Current deals include the standard AirPods 4 for $99.99 and the ANC model for around $148.99 at various retailers.
- AirPods Pro (second-gen) available for $169.99, featuring better noise cancellation and a USB-C charging case.
- AirPods Max are on sale for $479.99, offering excellent sound quality and noise cancellation features.

items.title: Steam Deck, ROG Ally, and More: The Handheld PC Gaming Revolution
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Valve’s support for non-Steam Deck handhelds is developing, with SteamOS expected to be available for other devices by April 2025.
- Asus ROG Ally X receives praise as a top Windows gaming handheld, while MSI Claw is criticized.
- The Steam Deck has become a market leader, reportedly selling multiple millions of units, outpacing its competitors combined.
- The Lenovo Legion Go S aims to compete with Steam Deck but faces initial criticisms regarding performance.
- Innovations such as battery upgrades for the ROG Ally and Kickstarter projects like the Steam Deck Folio indicate ongoing development in handheld gaming tech.
